Description: Size in bytes of a cache block (cache line), which is the smallest unit of data transferred between cache and memory.
Constraints: ['Cache blocks represent a contiguous, naturally aligned power-of-two (or NAPOT) range of memory locations', 'The size of a cache block shall be uniform throughout the system']
Keywords: uniform, size of a cache block, implementation-specific, shall, implementation-specific, cache block, size, NAPOT, shall be, shall be uniform, shall

Description: The total amount of data (in bytes) that a cache can store.
Constraints: None explicitly mentioned (only that it is implementation-specific).
Keywords: implementation-specific, capacity of a cache, capacity, cache

Description: The structural layout of a cache (e.g., number of sets, associativity, ways, replacement policy).
Constraints: None explicitly mentioned (only that it is implementation-specific).
Keywords: implementation-specific, organization, cache, organization of a cache

Description: Implementation-defined capacity and internal organization of each cache, including how cache blocks are arranged and managed.
Constraints: None beyond being discoverable via the execution environment.

Description: The capacity and organization of a cache.
Encoding of read and write accessibility of CSRs based on privilege level
Constraints: ['12-bit encoding space for up to 4,096 CSRs', 'Top 4 bits (csr[11:8]) encode read/write accessibility and lowest privilege level', 'Top 2 bits (csr[11:10]) indicate read/write (00, 01, 10) or read-only (11) access', 'Next 2 bits (csr[9:8]) encode the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR']
Keywords: privilege level, according to, encode, conventional, by convention, accessibility

Description: Whether to follow the conventional encoding of CSR address bits csr[11:8] for read/write accessibility and minimal privilege level
Constraints: If followed, csr[11:10] = 00, 01, or 10 indicates read/write; =11 indicates read-only; csr[9:8] encodes lowest privilege level allowed to access CSR.

Description: Controls whether and how CSR read/write accessibility and minimum privilege level are encoded in bits [11:8] of the CSR address.
Constraints: The 12-bit CSR address space (csr[11:0]) is fixed by the ISA, but the encoding of accessibility in bits [11:8] is only conventional and not mandated. Implementations may use alternative encodings or omit this convention.
Keywords: by convention, according to, as shown in Table 1

Description: Defines the encoding scheme for CSR addresses, specifically the bits used for accessibility.
Constraints: A 12-bit encoding space is reserved for CSRs, with specific bits designated for accessibility.

Description: The actual number of Control and Status Registers implemented within the 12-bit encoding space.
Adherence to the standard mapping where csr[11:10] determines R/W permissions and csr[9:8] determines the minimum privilege level.
Constraints: Top two bits (11) must indicate read-only to follow convention.

Description: The enforcement of access control based on the encoding of bits csr[9:8] relative to the current execution privilege mode.
Constraints: Must encode the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR according to Table 1.

Description: Describes the conventional use of the upper 4 bits of the CSR address for encoding read/write accessibility and privilege level.
Constraints: ['Upper 4 bits (csr[11:8]) are used for encoding.', 'Top two bits (csr[11:10]) indicate read/write (00, 01, 10) or read-only (11).', 'Next two bits (csr[9:8]) encode the lowest privilege level for access.']

Description: The mapping of CSR addresses to read and write accessibility
Constraints: The upper 4 bits of the CSR address (csr[11:8]) are used to encode the read and write accessibility

Description: The encoding of read and write accessibility of CSRs
Constraints: The top two bits (csr[11:10]) indicate whether the register is read/write (00,01, or 10) or read-only (11)

Description: The encoding of the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR
Constraints: The next two bits (csr[9:8]) encode the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR
